translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Fourth Section
The Discussion of Equanimity
“Is the Arahant possessed of six kinds of equanimity?”
“Yes.”

original: Arahā chahi phassehi, chahi vedanāhi, chahi saññāhi …pe… chahi paññāhi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: arahā chahi phassehi chahi vedanāhi chahi saññāhi pe chahi paññāhi samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “Is the Arahant possessed of six kinds of contact, six kinds of feeling, six kinds of perception, six kinds of volition, and six kinds of consciousness?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the Arahant possessed of six kinds of equanimity?”
“Yes.”

original: Arahā cakkhunā rūpaṁ passanto sotena saddaṁ suṇāti, ghānena gandhaṁ ghāyati, jivhāya rasaṁ sāyati, kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṁ phusati, manasā dhammaṁ vijānāti …pe…
analyzed: arahā cakkhunā rūpam passantaḥ sotena saddam suṇāti ghānena gandham ghāyati jivhāya rasam sāyati kāyena phoṭṭhabbam phusati manasā dhammam vijānāti pe
translated: “When the Arahant sees a visible object with the eye, does he hear a sound with the ear, smell an odour with the nose, taste a flavour with the tongue, touch a tangible with the body, and cognize a mental object with the mind? …

original: manasā dhammaṁ vijānanto cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, sotena saddaṁ suṇāti, ghānena gandhaṁ ghāyati, jivhāya rasaṁ sāyati, kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṁ phusatīti?
analyzed: manasā dhammam vijānanto cakkhunā rūpam passati sotena saddam suṇāti ghānena gandham ghāyati jivhāya rasam sāyati kāyena phoṭṭhabbam phusati iti
translated: When the Arahant cognizes a mental object with the mind, does he see a visible object with the eye, hear a sound with the ear, smell an odour with the nose, taste a flavour with the tongue, and touch a tangible with the body?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the Arahant possessed of six kinds of equanimity?”
“Yes.”

original: Satataṁ samitaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ chahi upekkhāhi samannāgato samohito, cha upekkhāyo paccupaṭṭhitāti?
analyzed: satatam samitam abbokiṇṇam chahi upekkhāhi samannāgato samohito cha upekkhāyo paccupaṭṭhitā ati
translated: Is he always and continually and uninterruptedly endowed with and possessed of six kinds of equanimity, with six kinds of equanimity present?🔽You may not say that.🔽You may not say that.🔽You may not say that.🔽You may not say that.
You may not say that.

analyzed: na vattabba  arahā chahi upekkhāhi samannāgato ti
translated: You may not say that.
You may not say that.🔽You may not say that.🔽You may not say that.
